page.title: 14Local Transport
page.content: The main method of transport in the area is by road, either in cars or buses. Half the area is served by a bus service but in the rural areas the private car is the only means of travel. Many people own a car as public transport is limited. The Inter-City trains do travel through the area but do not stop; but if required one can be boarded at St. Austell. These trains travel from London to Penzance. Many children own a bicycle and can be seen riding in the lanes on Sunday afternoons and after school during the week. Many E.C.L.P. lorries use the roads in the area to transport China Clay. The local farms make considerable use of farm machinery such as tractors and trailers. These sometimes cause a few problems when they have to travel along the narrow lanes. (Sue Hall)
